sub_title: PMO | Portfolio, Program & Project Management | Lean six sigma | Strategy & Innovation | Business Analysis
summary:
“Failure is simply the opportunity to begin again, this time more intelligently.” – Henry Ford

I try to keep my projects within scope, budget and on schedule. Having 5+ years of corporate experience in the areas of Program and Project Management, my strength lies in ensuring the success of the projects through streamlined processes, capturing and sharing best practices & creating winning teams. Known as an innovative thinker with strong communication skills, I have had the opportunity to provide project management guidance to cross-functional teams, lead and facilitate project planning, risk management and financial forecasting efforts, maintain project KPIs, report high level program status to executives and help the teams adapt to innovative and agile ways of working. My experience with corporates, operating in different industries at different positions has taught me to appreciate openness, innovation and cultural diversity.

Being a Green Belt six sigma certified profession, I have worked with manufacturing teams to derive meaningful insights from data, look for improvement opportunities and design innovative solutions in a very structured manner, thereby leading to improvement in yield throughput (%) of products from 15% to 85%. I have incorporated the methods of lean principles (Kaizen, VSM, RCA, 5S, TPM) to bring in operational improvements, leading to savings of 500,000 USD.

Having pursued an MBA in the field of International Business from Nyenrode University, Amsterdam, I have had the opportunity to work as an MBA student consultant for various companies. Through these consulting projects, I have developed a deep understanding of how to successfully carry out such projects, delivering outstanding results and managing customer expectations.

Currently working as a PMO, I am looking for the next best opportunity in the Netherlands to utilise my structured creativity and results proven ability in delivering value to the organisation and its customers.

profile_positions.description:
• Provide support for portfolio management of New-builds across Europe by aligning projects with the organisation's overall strategy, making the best use of limited resources, and building synergies between programs.
• Work together with cross functional teams (Design, signage, technical, marketing, logistics, procurement, operations, finance & legal) to ensure strategic management of program from inception to completion. Adhere to project management processes to ensure the delivery of projects on-time, on-budget, within scope and meeting quality standards.
• Liaise with regulatory bodies for the review of technical and design aspects of the project to ensure compliance with the International safety guidelines.
• Escalate priorities to the senior management via weekly/monthly updates. Regular communication of project status to internal and external stakeholders.
• Provide inputs on project planning method, setting up of stage gate reviews and following-up closely with key participants for completion of milestones.
• Facilitate a transparent risk management process involving key stakeholders. Document the risks and identify the action items for POCs in each department.
• Facilitate best practice sharing, and steer lessons learned sessions with all key stakeholders to optimise efficiency across the project portfolio.
• Maintain and document all changes requested from cross-functional teams, present them to the change advisory board for approval, and ensure that all approved changes are implemented within the specified budget.
• Perform vendor/third party supplier consultations to monitor progress, ascertain and define areas in order to obtain solutions.
• Aid the teams in adjusting to different working cultures, evolve and adopt agile productive ways of working.
profile_positions.title: Program Management Officer, Mission Control - Newbuilding & Innovation

profile_positions.description: Mapped out internal processes of the company to improve operational excellence and efficiency using lean principles, knowledge management and change management strategy. Developed key KPI’s to be measured for successful value chain operations.
profile_positions.title: MBA Intern

profile_positions.description:
Analyzing Verizon as a telecommunication’s company and thus formulating a strategic plan for its penetration into the European Union (EU) market by 2020 to capture the potential offered by the development of 5G technology. 
As part of our analysis, we looked at the company’s current business and strategy, key products and competitive advantage, vision and capabilities along with an analysis of the EU market, union policies, existing infrastructure and market competition.
profile_positions.title: MBA Student consultant

profile_positions.description:
Worked as an external student innovation consultant for Sandoz to help them verify and structure the data in a more efficient way
Primary focus of this project was to identify the current challenges that the company is facing in a highly regulated environment, finding out which type of innovation the company can afford given the industry, identifying the innovation area and formulating a plan on implementing the innovative solutions. The solutions were presented to the Chief Financial Officer of Sandoz, Netherlands, Mr. Adri Simamora.
profile_positions.title: MBA Student Consultant

profile_positions.description:
As part of the 'Meet the CEO' session, worked in a team to develop a business model and prototype of a working healthsuite app, using Design Thinking methodologies, for the revival of Philip's cloud based personal healthcare management platform.  
The business plan and the working prototype of the app was presented to the Chief Innovation and Strategy Officer of Royal Philips Mr. Jeroen Tas.
profile_positions.title: MBA Student Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Worked on a external consultancy project for Google in Zurich and London as a part of Global sourcing and Innovation modules.
The scope of the project was to develop a sustainable business model for one of Google's retail clients using the proven Google technologies. 
Within this project, the solutions were primarily focused on using Google Cloud platform for creating personalized customer experience and contributing to sustainable food production, distribution and consumption by reducing waste and optimizing product life.
profile_positions.title: MBA Student Consultant

profile_positions.description:
As part of the 'Meet the CEO' module, worked in a team to find solutions to increase customer engagement for Small Steps. 
The primary tasks were to understand the current childcare system in the Netherlands, the current challenges that Smallsteps is facing and finding solutions to the following three problems
1. How can we engage  parents and children in the ‘after school care’ (children between 4 and 12) in Netherlands?
2. What new 21st century skill developments are needed to keep the children between the age group of 10-12 engaged?
3. For children near the age of 12 and above, what solutions can be provided to assist them in their overall development? 
The business model was presented to the Chief Executive Officer of Kids Foundation, Ms. Jeanine Lemmens
profile_positions.title: MBA Student Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Process Management
1. Worked with manufacturing & AME teams to develop and deploy six sigma solutions which led to an improvement in yield throughput (%) of products from 15% to 85%.
2. Facilitated and implemented lean methods (Kaizen, VSM, RCA, 5S, TPM) to bring in operational improvements, leading to customer savings of $500,000. Used six sigma tools to capture the process
variance and suggested suitable measures to design a new process which meets six sigma level.
3. Coordinated with cross-functional teams to analyze the functional requirements, conducted feasibility study and gap analysis to develop lean strategy.
4. Negotiated with electronic component suppliers for effective on time delivery and improved quality. Participated in stage gate reviews to contribute to vendor quality management procedures.

Project management
1. Managed client and stakeholder relationships and built new strong cross-functional relationships.
2. Tracked project deliverable, managed and mitigated risks and effectively communicated project updates with key stakeholders. 
3. Used project management skills to ensure that all projects have a well defined scope, detailed project plan, WBS activities. Ensured that projects are well within schedule and budget and also exceeds quality expectations. Calculated the SPI and CPI for all projects.

Leadership & Strategy
1. Led a team of young engineers, mentored, coached and nurtured new technological ideas to support the end to end development of Electronic test systems.
2. Worked with Design, engineering and AME teams to perform cost benefit analysis for new NPD and NPI projects.
3. Developed test strategy, test coverage analysis, proposed engineering design improvements and led the execution of several aerospace projects at onsite (Mississauga, Canada) and offsite (Bangalore) locations.
4. Managed technical data, converted numbers into actionable insights for management team to take business decisions using SQL, Tableau.
profile_positions.title: Senior Electronics Engineer/Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Process management 
1. Established, maintained and improved processes for Operator Standard Work documents, technical manuals and other related technical documentation. 
2. Developed a new Value Stream Map (VSM 2.0) for the Engineering department in order
to achieve high efficiency with low cost.
3. Identified opportunities for improvements and worked with teams to reduce waste.
4. Worked with project managers and quality head to adhere to aerospace quality procedures by developing key quality KPIs.

Project management
1. Assisted project leaders in project estimation, cost analysis, high level design concept, requirement management, electronics circuit design, analysis, implementation & testing of technical solutions.
2. Reviewed and assessed project’s financial performance against projections and identify the areas of improvement and reducing the scope creep.

Engineering
1. Part of the LCM department that covered the testing and certification of products.
2. Designed, developed and deployed automated/manual test equipment, acceptance test procedures, interface and interconnect cable harnesses, PCB design, data acquisition systems, mechanical fixtures for testing avionics electronic controllers and Coordinated with third party vendors for manufacturing and certification.
3. Documented best practices and facilitated knowledge sharing across teams to define
future roadmap of engineering test strategy.
4. An active member of electronics design team assisting project leader in requirements management, electronics circuit design, analysis, implementation & testing of aerospace electronics products/printed circuit cards.
5. Understood/reviewed high level product requirements and derived low level functional requirements to be implemented.
6. Involved in System Testing (Hardware & Software integration) with a key focus on FMEA and involvement in design reviews.
profile_positions.title: Test Engineer/Asst. Project Manager
